info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN MORA AND SOUTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM MDT... At 1012 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Springer, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springer, Cimarron, Maxwell, Philmont Scout Ranch and Miami. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 407 and 431. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 306 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on Interstate 25 will create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
